_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Special Die and Tool, Die Set, Jig, and Fixture Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Kocher + Beck

RMP Executive Summary





1.Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies.

We at Kocher + Beck of Lenexa, KS are committed to employees Health and Safety.



2.The Stationary Source and the Regulated Substances Handled.

Our facility's primary activities encompass metal etching, while using liquified chlorine to purify ferric chloride.  The off-gas chlorine is scrubbed within ventilation system.



3.The Worst Case Release Scenario(s) and Alternative Release Scenario(s), including

To perform the required off-site consequence analysis for our facility, we have used the RMP program.  The worst case release scenario submitted for the RMP program for toxic substances as a class one alternative release scenario has been submitted for the toxic substance chlorine.  The alternative release scenario for chlorine involves a potential valve leak.



4.The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and the Chemical ? Specific Prevention.



Process Safety Information: The Kocher + Beck  facility maintains details of safety measures for chlorine system.



Process Hazard Analysis:  Our facility conducts periodic studies to ensure that the chlorine hazard is minimized.



Operating Procedures:  For the purposes of safely conducting activities within our company.



Training:  Kocher + Beck employees have been HazMat trained for handling Chlorine and other chemicals within the facility.



Mechanical Integrity:  Kocher + Beck personnel carry out regular inspection of chlorine equipment.



Management of Change: Written procedures are in-place at Kocher + Beck for personnel and appropriate responsibilities.



Compliance Audits:  The City of Lenexa fire department provides compliance audits. (Annual inspection)



Incident Investigation:  Kocher + Beck will promptly investigated any potential incidents.



Employee Participation:  Kocher + Beck  management believes employees should be completely informed of potential Safety and Health Issues.

Five-Year Accident History:  The Kocher + Beck facility  has had no accidents.



Emergency Response Plan:  Kocher + Beck has written a emergency response plan.  The emergency response equipment, ie S.C.B.A., chemical resisteant suits, etc are  regularly inspected.       

The City of Lenexa Fire Department will provide backup upon Kocher+Beck USA, L.P. request.
